titleStmt.title: John R. Thomas et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG6983

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Lebanon Kentucky
Sept 2d 1865
To His Excellency Gov. Thos. E. Bramlette
Frankfort
Kentucky:

Your petitioners citizens and residents of Marion County Kentucky would respectfully represent that Wm J. Young was by a Grand jury of Marion County indicted for the offence of "Suffering and permitting gaming upon his premises" at their June Term 1865, and at the August Term 1865 of said Court said W. J. Young came in open court and confessed judgement for $200. Your petitioners think that the case is one in which executive intereference is demanded, and would respectfully ask that your Excellency pardon and remit the said fine. -- your petitioners say that said Young is a young man just commencing business in life, and of good character, and if the fine has to be paid will result very oppressively to him.

John R. Thomas
B. Spalding
W. J.
Wm Rains
John W McWhorter
over
Names
P. B. Cooper one of the Grand Jury
J B Mcwhorter S, T, C
G W Penn
T. C. Jackson,
F. B. Merimee
Jno T Milburn

Marion Cir Ct
vs
Wm J Young
Gaming
$200.
Remitted 5 Sept/65
